title: Casa Santos Lima 2013 Cabra Cega Red (Lisboa)
description: This wood-aged wine shows dark berry fruits and a dusty structure. That goes with the juicy fruitiness that is perfumed, fresh and spicy. The wine has a stalky aftertaste with plenty of acidity. Drink now.

title: Casa Santos Lima 2013 Espiga Reserva Red (Lisboa)
description: The wine is smooth, soft and juicy. It has a fine balance, ripe with berry fruits and light with acidity and a easy-going texture. The oak aging has served to smooth any tannins, leaving a wine that is ready to drink.

title: Castello della Rosa 2014 Pinot Grigio (Vigneti delle Dolomiti)
description: Delicate aromas of honeysuckle, white stone fruit and citrus present themselves to the nose while the fun, simple palate shows green pear and a hint of lime. Zesty acidity gives it a tangy close.

title: Árido 2012 Sustainably Farmed Malbec (Mendoza)
description: This smells a bit stalky and murky, without much pop or freshness to the nose. A medium-bodied palate feels about right, while this tastes earthy, stalky and like roasted plum. Herbal notes come up on the finish.

title: Black Star Farms 2012 Arcturos Cabernet Franc (Michigan)
description: Bramble patch aromas evoke the entire bush: from stems to berries. A raspberry Jell-O note mingles with juicy red cherry on the light-bodied palate, making this a great crowd-pleasing wine.

title: Black Star Farms 2013 Arcturos Pinot Gris (Old Mission Peninsula)
description: There's a slight pink hue to this light-bodied white. Citrus focused and a bit blossomy, this is simple and straightforward yet perfectly enjoyable.

title: Bodega Zafado 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)
description: Saucy, herbal aromas of tomato and red plum are scratchy. This is fresh and juicy, but also high in acidity. Flavors of red plum, red currant and vanilla come with herbal infusions prior to a mildly spicy finish.

title: Endrizzi 2014 Pinot Grigio (Trentino)
description: This simple white opens with scents of honeysuckle and ripe orchard fruit while the easygoing palate offers hints of nectarine and green apple. Fresh acidity gives it a brisk finish.

title: Fiuza NV Tres Castas Sparkling (Tejo)
description: Light both in alcohol and texture, this is a tank fermented sparkling wine that's bright, just off dry and fruity. It makes a great apéritif style.

title: Edna Valley Vineyard 2014 Fleur de Edna Winemaker Series Chardonnay (Edna Valley)
description: Extremely ripe and tropical aromas of tuberose, jasmine and apple blossoms prove quite overpowering on the nose of this wine. The palate shows lots of apple juice flavors and trends toward banana and pineapple tropicality.

title: Marco Scolaris 2014 Friulano (Collio)
description: Nut, flint and apple skin aromas lead the nose. The palate is quite lean, showing mineral and bitter almond alongside racy acidity.

title: Minassian-Young 2013 Big Barrel Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: This Zin, which gets a boost from 20% Grenache and 5% Petite Sirah, shows a slightly sweet touch on the nose, where dark strawberry and baked cherries meet with a touch of asphalt. The palate is quite syrup and fruit-driven, with blueberry, blackberry, cola and root-beer flavors reminiscent of soda-pop concentrate.

title: Gothic 2013 Nevermore Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Gothic is the project of a New York-based restaurateur and sommelier team. This spent 10 months in 15% new French oak. Scents and flavors of rubber tire dominate, and the tannins are hard and harsh. Airing it out helps a bit, but the bitterness does not entirely disappear.

title: River's Edge 2013 Indulgence Pinot Gris (Elkton Oregon)
description: The winery's regular Pinot Gris approaches 15% alcohol, and this takes it a step farther. Not overly sweet, but identifiably late harvest, the fermentation has been stopped at 60g/L residual sugar, and fortified with some neutral spirit. White Port may have been the concept, but it hasn't really come together in the bottle.

title: SalvaTerra 2014 Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)
description: This deeply yellow-gold coloured wine opens with mature aromas of nut, flint and dried apricot. The lean palate is also already evolved, offering smoky mineral and yellow apple skin alongside firm acidity.

title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2014 Fernão Pires (Tejo)
description: Produced from a single vineyard, this fresh, fruity wine combines intense citrus and crisp apple fruits. They are shot through with a zingy, textured character that adds interest and brings out the bright acidity. Drink now.

title: Pazos del Rey 2014 Pazo de Monterrey Godello (Monterrei)
description: Aromas of orange and grapefruit are clean and easy. This feels citrusy but that's about it. Standard orange and lemon-lime flavors finish with juicy snap. Drink this rudimentary Godello as soon as possible.

title: Torre Rosazza 2014 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Colli Orientali)
description: Intense but rather muddled aromas of Stargazer lily and air freshener lead the nose along with brief dashes of hay, mature peach and apple. The unusual flowery aroma carries through and dominates the lean palate.

title: Tramuz 2014  Ribera del Duero
description: Aromas of cherry and unconstituted berry drink mix precede a spunky palate with cherry and sweet oak flavors. A dry finish offers oaky cocoa notes and standard residual berry flavors.

title: Liberty School 2014 Chardonnay (Central Coast)
description: Extremely light on aromas, this bottling eventually shows lemon peel, chalk and slate. The palate is simple yet clean, with flavors of pear, nectarine and lime peels.

title: Griffin Creek 2012 Tempranillo (Rogue Valley)
description: Tart and tight, this mixes chalky, citrus-inflected acids with light fruit flavors of wild berries. There's a palate-drying minerality, and the sharp acids and ultradry tannins are tough to punch through.

title: Herdade do Esporão 2014 Alandra Tinto Red (Portuguese Table Wine)
description: Trincadeira, Moreto and Castelão form the blend for this stalky, fruity wine. It shows no signs of wood aging, boasting only fresh red fruits and balanced acidity. The aftertaste is fresh, continuing the fruity theme.

title: Kudos 2014 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Light and fruity, this shows some sugary sweetness, much like some of the inexpensive California Pinots. It's a simple, quaffable red wine with a cherry-lollipop flavor.

title: Ileana 2014 Low Carb Pinot Grigio (Vigneti delle Dolomiti)
description: This fresh, informal white opens with subdued aromas of yellow flower and white orchard fruit. The lean, simple palate offers unripe pear, apple skin and a mineral note alongside crisp acidity.

title: Zorzon 2014 Pinot Grigio (Collio)
description: Aromas of almond, pressed white flower and crushed stone emerge on this racy white. The palate is less expressive, showing apple skin, mineral and a hint of citrus. It's on the lean side, with brisk acidity.

title: Cormòns 2014 Pinot Grigio (Collio)
description: This presents the nose whiffs of pineapple and wet stone while the lean palate offers rennet apple skin, tangerine and a hint of mineral. Bracing acidity dominates the finish.

title: Casa Santos Lima 2014 Quinta das Amoras Red (Lisboa)
description: Sheltered by a coastal range of hills from the Atlantic Ocean, this vineyard has produced a ripe soft wine that has gentle tannins and succulent red fruits. The aftertaste is fresh, continuing the fruit theme. The wine is ready to drink.

title: Caves Transmontanas 2012 Terra a Terra Reserva Red (Douro)
description: This finely structured wine with its intense acidity and tight tannins has a cool, high-altitude feel to it. It's a single vineyard wine from Quinta Terra, fresh and with red currant acidity. The wine can be drunk, although the acidity is such that it will be better to wait until the end of 2016 for it soften.

title: Cesari 2014 Duetorri Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)
description: This informal white offers aromas of citrus blossom and peach while the light, simple palate shows pear, a touch of lime and a hint of mineral. Zesty acidity leaves a fresh finish.

title: Adega Mãe 2014 Riesling (Lisboa)
description: The wine is tight, tangy and crisp. It has hints of the perfumes that are typical of Riesling although it's more of a fresh, lively wine that has lightness and plenty of acidity at the end.
